class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(This course is designed as a survey course and an acting class. Its focus is to study the concept of Make-Believe: how we as human beings pretend and use fantasy as an extension of our own personalities, and then how these perspectives translate into the art of Acting and expressing fictional characters and personality illusion. There is an element of the actor is all of us. The world of Make-Believe feeds human creativity as well as exercising the ability to Pretend in formulating behaviors in our public and private interpersonal relationships. As a theater course, there will be a series of performance exercises/assignments as well as analytical discussion along with written perspectives related to selected issues on the topic. As a result, students will be expected to be acting in the course with fictional characters and exercising examples of personality traits in how we use Pretending to create impression, attitude, and image.)
